mutations.name: updateRefs
mutations.description:
Creates, updates and/or deletes multiple refs in a repository.

This mutation takes a list of RefUpdates and performs these updates on the repository. All updates are performed atomically, meaning that if one of them is rejected, no other ref will be modified.

RefUpdate.beforeOid specifies that the given reference needs to point to the given value before performing any updates. A value of 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 can be used to verify that the references should not exist.

RefUpdate.afterOid specifies the value that the given reference will point to after performing all updates. A value of 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 can be used to delete a reference.

If RefUpdate.force is set to true, a non-fast-forward updates for the given reference will be allowed.

If the pull request is not visible but the user has opted to show private contributions, a RestrictedContribution will be returned.

objects.name: Organization
objects.description: An account on GitHub, with one or more owners, that has repositories, members and teams.

fields.name: anyPinnableItems
fields.description: Determine if this repository owner has any items that can be pinned to their profile.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Filter to only a particular kind of pinnable item.

arguments.name: after
arguments.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

arguments.name: before
arguments.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

arguments.name: first
arguments.description: Returns the first n elements from the list.

arguments.name: last
arguments.description: Returns the last n elements from the list.

arguments.name: orderBy
arguments.description: Ordering options for the returned audit log entries.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The query string to filter audit entries.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: A URL pointing to the organization's public avatar.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of the resulting square image.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: Identifies the primary key from the database.

fields.name: descriptionHTML
fields.description: The organization's public profile description rendered to HTML.

arguments.name: last

fields.name: vulnerableVersionRange
fields.description:
A string that describes the vulnerable package versions. This string follows a basic syntax with a few forms.

  • = 0.2.0 denotes a single vulnerable version.
  • <= 1.0.8 denotes a version range up to and including the specified version
  • < 0.1.11 denotes a version range up to, but excluding, the specified version
  • >= 4.3.0, < 4.3.5 denotes a version range with a known minimum and maximum version.
  • >= 0.0.1 denotes a version range with a known minimum, but no known maximum.

enums.description: The possible states for a check suite or run conclusion.

values.name: ACTION_REQUIRED
values.description: The check suite or run requires action.

values.name: CANCELLED
values.description: The check suite or run has been cancelled.

values.name: FAILURE
values.description: The check suite or run has failed.

values.name: NEUTRAL
values.description: The check suite or run was neutral.

values.name: SKIPPED
values.description: The check suite or run was skipped.

values.name: STALE
values.description: The check suite or run was marked stale by GitHub. Only GitHub can use this conclusion.

values.name: STARTUP_FAILURE
values.description: The check suite or run has failed at startup.

values.name: SUCCESS
values.description: The check suite or run has succeeded.

values.name: TIMED_OUT
values.description: The check suite or run has timed out.

values.description: Every check run available.

values.name: IN_PROGRESS
values.description: The check suite or run is in progress.

values.name: QUEUED
values.description: The check suite or run has been queued.

values.name: REQUESTED
values.description: The check suite or run has been requested.

values.name: WAITING
values.description: The check suite or run is in waiting state.

scalars.name: Float
scalars.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

preview.title: Update refs preview
preview.description: This preview adds support for updating multiple refs in a single operation.

scalars.name: GitTimestamp
scalars.description: An ISO-8601 encoded date string. Unlike the DateTime type, GitTimestamp is not converted in UTC.

scalars.name: ID
scalars.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

scalars.name: Int
scalars.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

scalars.name: PreciseDateTime
scalars.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date string with millisecond precision.

scalars.name: String
scalars.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

scalars.name: URI
scalars.description: An RFC 3986, RFC 3987, and RFC 6570 (level 4) compliant URI string.
